Judul: STUDY OF HEATING EFFECT ON 200?, 400?, AND 600? GEOMECHANICAL PROPERTIES OF SANDSTONE AND THE APPLICATION OF UNDERGROUND COAL GASIFICATION
Abstrak:
High-rank coal reserves are increasingly depleted due to the conventional mining and consequently underground
coal gasification (UCG) can serve as an alternative to uneconomically coal reserves i.e. low-rank, thin, and high
depth seam coal. Gasified coal will leave cavities in the coal seam and transfer heat around the rock mass. The
influence of heat will affect properties of the rock mass which can disrupt underground stability.
In this research, sandstones are used as samples and heated in temperature of 200?, 400?, and 600?. These
samples are analyzed using X-ray diffraction (XRD), X-ray fluorescence (XRF), and scanning electron microscope
(SEM) to examine the effect of heating to its mineralogy. Cavities as the result of gasification in coal seam are
then numerically modeled on Rock and Soil 2-D analysis software (RS2).
From XRD and XRF analysis results, there are no major difference in the mineral composition and elements of
the sandstone samples before and after heated. There is considerable potential of instability on cavities after coal
is gasified compared to ordinary cavities without the influence of heat.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Nuhindro Priagung Widodo, Rudy Sayoga Gauyama, Ginting Jalu Kusuma, Budi Sulistianto
